name: emi.unicore-hila
description: HiLA is an API for accessing Grid resources of different middleware in a consistent manner. It has been implemented for UNICORE versions 5 and 6, and an OGSA-BES implementation is also available. HiLA is in use in various places in different Grid access libraries.
releaseNotes:
What's new

    * Allow for relative paths in UNICORE 6 configuration file.

    * Support for reservations.

    * Timeout and refresh interval for site discovery configurable. SF Feature 3160069

    * Support for ServiceOrchestrator.

    * Using EHCache instead of an unbounded(!) hash map for Site caching

    * ComputeTask is called Job now for more clarity

    * Recursive import and export

    * Tasks store error conditions for detailed inspection

    * Improved blocking on local tasks

    * Improved file caching

    * Import from and export to streams

    * mkdir creates recursive directory strucures only if explicitly requested, otherwise refuses to create (resembles mkdir -p behavior)



Installation and configuration

    * yum install unicore-hila-shel

    * unicore-hila-shell depends on unicore-hila-unicore6, as it is the only implementation of the abstract interface at the moment.

    * After installation, when hila-shell is started for the first time, it will copy a sample configuration using demo certificates into the user's home directory under ~/.hila2 if no configuration previously exists in that location. The file unicore6.properties in that directory will have to be edited for the infrastructure that is to be used.



Known issues

    * None at the time of release.
